title: Ignorant Sydney driver leaves his luxury Lexus blocking BOTH lanes of traffic
text:
The mystery driver of a Lexus has been blasted for leaving his luxury 4WD blocking both lanes of traffic inside a shopping centre car park.

The motorist left their directly next to a pedestrian crossing inside the car park at Marrickville's Metro Shopping Centre, west of Sydney.

An angry shopper called out the driver online after noticing they had no way out of the car park.

The driver of a luxury Lexus 4WD has left shoppers stunned after parking across the car park lane blocking both directions instead of finding a parking spot

Images of a silver Lexus 4WD was posted to Facebook by an angry shopper after they had seen a number of other posts targetting parking at the shopping centre

'I've seen a few posts about poor parking at the Metro, but I think I have a winner,' the man wrote alongside the images.

Others were quick to jump on the post to shame the driver, Yahoo News reported.

'Oh hands down the best park... give that person an award,' one user wrote.

Another made a 'Specsavers' joke, insinuating the driver may have had bad sight.

Another person was left stunned by the simple placement of the 4WD.

'OMG – it's actually on the road,' they wrote.

Another person simply said it 'the worst park' he'd ever seen.

All parking at Marrickville’s Metro Shopping Centre is free with over 1000 spots available.
description: The driver of a luxury Lexus 4WD has left shoppers stunned after parking across the car park lane blocking both directions instead of finding a parking spot.
authors: Adam Mccleery For Daily Mail Australia
